page.title: 10The River Tamar
page.content: The{River Tamar}has its{source}at the{Tamar Lake}near to{Hartland {Point.}This beautiful river helps to forms the{border between the counties {of Devon and Cornwall,}and flows into the sea at Plymouth. Along the stretch which splits our survey area there are {five weirs}to be found.Four of these were built to form{deep pools to {encourage the spawning of salmon. One, {at Latchley, was constructed so that {water could be taken off and carried {by leats to drive water wheels and {stamps (crushing machines) at the {Devon Consol Mines. The whole of the upper Tamar Valley is rich in wild life of all kinds, and is{scenically beautiful.
